page.title: 09THE LIFE OF A CHILD 1986
page.content: I am 10 year old Stephen Selway. On a school day, I get up at 8.00 a.m. and go to bed at 9.00 p.m. On a weekend I get up at 9.00a.m. and go to bed at 10 p.m. For breakfast I have Weetabix. On school days, for lunch I have sandwiches, crisps, cake or biscuits; but on weekends I have cooked lunches, baked beans, fried eggs, toast, chips etc. Then I play football with my friends or go on a bike ride around the lanes. If it is raining I watch TV or play snooker. My pets are 100 fish and a small rabbit. I think Binegar is nice, I would not like to move. My Mum goes shopping a lot. She goes to Midsomer Norton or to the local shops, 100 yd. away. My Dad is a builder and my Mum is a housewife. I have a brother who is 4 and a sister who is 7. We go to the village school, there are56 pupils.I walk there up the lane.
